title: Ticket #4705: use proper kibi and Ki abbreviations for powers of 2
description:
Sprinkled throughout the manual are old style references to powers of 2, which are now ambiguous. Time to follow the NIST standard at

http://physics.nist.gov/cuu/Units/binary.html

For 1024 bytes, proper use is kibibytes, or KiB. Capitalization is significant for the abbreviated form KiB. (A lower case 'b' indicates bits.)

For 2^20 bytes, proper use is mebibyte, or MiB. Capitalization is significant for the abbreviated form MiB. (A lower case 'b' indicates bits.)

This ticket's task is to find all instances of things like Kbytes and Mbytes that are supposed to refer to powers of 2, and change them to follow the standard.
